channel.title: Item Drops
channel.description:
Hey, say i only wanted 1 drop for a monster, nothing else...
How would i make it do a random pick out of that list...
But it's only 1 item, so it would pick that item all the time...
Example
[code] public static int 1Drop[] = {1050}; [/code]
Ok thats a santa. How would i make it drop that item.. But it would make it a rare drop, not all the time drop?... Is it something to do with... [code] return 1Drop[(int)(Math.random()*1Drop.length)]; [/code]
This may sound a bit stupid, but i'm explaining as thourough as i can..
Ok when i kill the monster, it drops a santa all of the time. How can i stop this, and make it drop rarely?.
Im confused myself lol..
Much apreciated.
[br][size=1]Posted on: November 05, 2007, 09:30:29 AM[/size][hr]5Th page, still no1?..

item.title: Item Drops
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

LOL, i could have told you that. ROFL. I though you just wanted a rare chance of dropping one item. LMAO.

Read full topic

item.title: Item Drops
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“Stanyer, post:7, topic:157351”]Why dont you just make it like:

public static int 1Drop[] = {1050, 532, 532, 532, 532, 532, 532, 532, 532, 532};

So there’s a 9/10 chance you’ll get some big bones, and a 1/10 chance you’ll get a Santa Hat.

You could always change the big bones to anything you like.[/quote]
LOOOOOOLLLLLLLLLLLL lolll i can’t believe i didn’t think of that… Cheers…
I’ll rep both of u, Syrillia tyvm for trying to help. Ty to Stanyer for the answer=p

Read full topic

item.title: Item Drops
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

Why dont you just make it like:

public static int 1Drop[] = {1050, 532, 532, 532, 532, 532, 532, 532, 532, 532};

So there’s a 9/10 chance you’ll get some big bones, and a 1/10 chance you’ll get a Santa Hat.

You could always change the big bones to anything you like.

Read full topic

Syrillia:

Oh hmm. Maybe 0. That might work. If not, I’ll look deeper.

item.title: Item Drops
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“Syrillia, post:2, topic:157351”]Just a random suggestion, but try;

public static int 1Drop[] = {1050, -1, -1};

I don’t know if that would work. It would technically give you something, but that something wouldn’t exist. Maybe that would work?[/quote]

I get what ur saying, lemme give it a go…[br][size=1]Posted on: November 06, 2007, 09:41:31 AM[/size][hr]When it drops -1… I get a client error…

So it DC’s when the npc dies.

Read full topic

item.title: Item Drops
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

Just a random suggestion, but try;

public static int 1Drop[] = {1050, -1, -1};

I don’t know if that would work. It would technically give you something, but that something wouldn’t exist. Maybe that would work?

Read full topic
